verses.verse: By the rivers <S%H5104><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>, there we sat down <S%H3427><s%>, Yes <S%H1058><s%>, we wept, when we remembered <S%H2142><s%> Zion <S%H6726><s%>.
We hung <S%H8518><s%> our harps <S%H3658><s%> upon the willows <S%H6155><s%> in the middle there <S%H8432><s%>.

For there they that carried us away captive <S%H7617><s%> required <S%H7592><s%> of us a song <S%H1697><s%>; and they that wasted <S%H8437><s%> us required of us mirth <S%H8057><s%>, saying <S%H7891><s%>, Sing us one of the songs <S%H7892><s%> of Zion <S%H6726><s%>.
How shall we sing <S%H7891><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>'s song <S%H7892><s%> in a strange <S%H5236><s%> land <S%H127><s%>?
If I forget <S%H7911><s%> you <S%H3389><s%>, O Jerusalem, let my right hand <S%H3225><s%> forget her skill <S%H7911><s%>.

If I do not remember <S%H2142><s%> you <S%H3956><s%>, let my tongue cleave <S%H1692><s%> to the roof of my mouth <S%H2441><s%>; if I prefer <S%H5927><s%> not Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> above my chief <S%H7218><s%> joy <S%H8057><s%>.

Remember <S%H2142><s%>, O Lord <S%H3068><s%>, the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Edom <S%H123><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>; who said <S%H559><s%>, Raze <S%H6168><s%> it <S%H6168><s%>, raze it <S%H3247><s%>, even to the foundation there.
O daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%>, who are to be destroyed <S%H7703><s%>; happy <S%H835><s%> shall he be <S%H7999><s%>, that rewards you as you have served us <S%H1580><s%>.
Happy <S%H835><s%> shall he be <S%H270><s%>, that takes and dashes <S%H5310><s%> your little ones <S%H5768><s%> against the stones <S%H5553><s%>.
